clinical_study.brief_title: Addiction Remission and Addiction Transfer After Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Addiction Remission and Addiction Transfer After Bariatric Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate addiction remission and addiction transfer after bariatric surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective study to evaluate addiction remission and addiction transfer 6, 12 and 24 month after primary surgery (sleeve gastrectomy, Roux-en-Y- gastric bypass and Omega-Loop gastric bypass) in obese patients. A questionnaire evaluating food addiction (Yale Food Scale), alcohol addiction (Audit Scale), nicotine addiction (Fagerström Scale), sport addiction, internet addiction and drug addiction (Drug Use Questionnaire) gets completed prior to surgery and 6, 12 and 24 month after surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Addiction remission (evaluated by questionnaire) after obesity surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Addiction transfer (evaluated by questionnaire) after obesity surgery
EWL 12 month after surgery measured as a physiological parameter at 1 year Follow-Up

arm_group.description: Obese patients who undergo sleeve gastrectomy fill in questionnaire
Obese patients who undergo roux-en-y-gastric bypass fill in questionnaire
Obese patients who undergo omega-loop gastric bypass fill in questionnaire

intervention.description: Every patient who undergo surgery will fill out a questionnaire containing validated scales concerning food, alcohol, nicotine, internet and sport addiction prior and 6, 12 and 24 month after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 35kg/m² and obesity related disease or BMI > 40kg/m²
Exclusion Criteria:
- decline of study participation
